alert.note: Alert for Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 2:23PM CST until January 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Texas, including the following areas, in south central Texas, Coastal Jackson and Inland Jackson. In southeast Texas, Coastal Matagorda, Inland Matagorda, Matagorda Islands and Wharton. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall expected through Wednesday morning. Widespread totals of 2-4 inches with locally up to 5 inches expected in areas of training showers and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
